abstract: The leaders of Spain, Greece and Latvia vowed to get their economic houses in order during an appearance at the World Economic Forum.
snippet: The leaders of Spain, Greece and Latvia vowed to get their economic houses in order during an appearance at the World Economic Forum.
lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland  Leaders from three of Europe’s most economically troubled countries said on Thursday that the financial crisis had only solidified their commitment to the euro, and they pledged to make budget cuts and other changes required for membership.

headline.main: Spain, Greece and Latvia Affirm Their Commitment to the Euro
headline.print_headline: Spain, Greece and Latvia Affirm Their Commitment to the Euro

abstract: Chief executives of the world’s biggest banks, including Bank of America and Deutsche Bank, met with policymakers in Davos on Thursday afternoon, concerned that their interests and opinions about financial regulation are going unheard.
snippet: Chief executives of the world’s biggest banks, including Bank of America and Deutsche Bank, met with policymakers in Davos on Thursday afternoon, concerned that their interests and opinions about financial regulation are going unheard.
lead_paragraph: Chief executives of the world’s biggest banks, including Bank of America and Deutsche Bank, met with policymakers in Davos on Thursday afternoon, concerned that their interests and opinions about financial regulation are going unheard.

headline.main: Worried Bankers Reach Out From the Sidelines

abstract: With the crisis, women’s ranks on Wall Street appear to be shrinking, which is one reason why Sallie Krawcheck’s return to finance has provoked such an outpouring.
snippet: With the crisis, women’s ranks on Wall Street appear to be shrinking, which is one reason why Sallie Krawcheck’s return to finance has provoked such an outpouring.
lead_paragraph: When Sallie Krawcheck was hired six months ago as president of global wealth and investment management at Bank of America, she was besieged with e-mail messages from current and former Wall Street women celebrating her return to the fray.

headline.main: Looking for Women in Wall Street’s Top Ranks

abstract: Hugh McColl Jr., who built Bank of America into the behemoth it is today, apparently feels really good about the bank’s new chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
snippet: Hugh McColl Jr., who built Bank of America into the behemoth it is today, apparently feels really good about the bank’s new chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
lead_paragraph: Hugh McColl Jr., who built Bank of America into the behemoth it is today, apparently feels really good about the bank’s new chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.

headline.main: Former BofA Chief Gives Moynihan High Marks
